One of my favorite games of all time. The kind of game you wish you could go back and play for the first time over again.

This Portal is really a great start for people new to the game, and the story is very dark as well. You have a practice of how to play Portal and then can play the sequel. Also surprisingly it runs on very low-end PCs (like mine). Really recommend it a total 10/10

I had always heard and saw Portal references but I had never actually played it until now. I felt truly immersed into the game after playing for hours on end. I'm thrilled to have finally played this game in 2021 - and I never knew the plot (or remembered if I had heard in the past). This game was challenging and I'm glad I figured out all the puzzles by myself without looking online. Gives me a great feeling of accomplishment.

The thing that really surprised me with this game is just how intuitive it is, from the way it teaches you how to play to moving around the different areas in the test chambers.

It manages to use its mechanics to their full potential in my opinion, and most of the time I was playing this, it kept surprising me with the different uses. 
For example, at the start you think "wow, you can travel with these" but then later on you're doing crazy shit with it like launching yourself 50 feet in the air (or across a huge room) at high speed and tripping up deadly robots with the portals or making them attack each other. 
It's been a long time since I've seen a game be so resourceful with its mechanics.

The story is presented through background dialogue and the environment more than anything, so while it's a little barebones, this also means it's not up in your face with it and instead leaves the puzzles and the portal mechanic in the spotlight, as it should. 

The music and sound design is fine, nothing to really write home about but the writing is quite good for what it is.
It has a strange, bleak yet cheery sense of humour and a few of the lines even made me laugh.

The [spoiler]end fight with GLaDOS[/spoiler] is the perfect way to end this game, I wasn't expecting it tbh but it made me feel very satisfied after beating the game.

This game is outstanding for it's time, the graphics, the voices and even all the models and sounds. The tests are super hard which gets many hours in the game, and makes it much more fun. The GLaDOS fight is incredible and is so fun i have replayed it an uncountable amount of times. Overall this game is a masterpeice, i definitely recommend it.
재밌어여 전 좀 머리가 나빠서 2시간 좀 넘게 걸렸네여 ㅎㅎ;; 가격도 준수하고 포탈이라는 소재를 이용하여 퍼즐을 푸는 즐거움이 있는 게임이예요
누구나 머리써서 즐길 수 있는 게임은 폭력성, 선정성 등의 위험에 노출되지 않아 남녀노소 접근하기 좋다는 점이 굉장히 좋았습니다. 게임 개발자들에게 경의를 표합니다. 개발자님들의 건강보다 게임이 중요하니 후속작 만들어주세요. 항상 건강하시고 그보다도 게임 개발 부탁드릴게요. 감사합니다.

A truly revolutionary game, even back when it was made.  Although it's greatly eclipsed by its sequel, there is still fun to be had with replaying the first installment, particularly in the puzzle solving and GLaDOS's funny and witty dialogue.  Both Portal games are must plays for anyone who is a fan of puzzle games or video games in general.

[b][Most Entertaining Puzzle Game of All-Time[/b]

+++++ Portal [b]Humour[/b] and the [b]Voice Acting[/b]
+++++ Simple yet Amazing: [b]The Portal Mechanics[/b]

++++ [b]Atmosphere[/b]
++++ Challenging bonus content

+++ Smooth [b]Controls[/b]
+++ Not a second wasted

++ [b][i]"Still Alive"[/i][/b]

+ [b]Inspired[/b] tons of games for years to come 

- [b]Meme'd[/b] to Death

-- [b]Last Chapters[/b] lose some steam
-- Kinda [b]Short[/b]
-- Normal Campaign is [b]Too Easy[/b]

[u]Other Thoughts[/u]
